application.name: Bind Contador de manutenção de zona

item.name: Cache Stats - Cache hash buckets
item.description: database hash buckets

item.name: Cache Stats - Cache db nodes
item.description: cache database nodes

item.name: Cache Stats - Delete LRU
item.description: cache records deleted due to memory exhaustion

item.name: Cache Stats - Delete TTL
item.description: cache records deleted due to TTL expiration

item.name: Cache Stats - Heap memory in use
item.description: cache heap memory in use

item.name: Cache Stats - Heap memory max
item.description: cache heap highest memory in use

item.name: Cache Stats - Heap memory total
item.description: cache heap memory total

item.name: Cache Stats - Tree memory in use
item.description: cache tree memory in use

item.name: Cache Stats - Tree memory max
item.description: cache tree highest memory in use

item.name: Cache Stats - Tree memory total
item.description: cache tree memory total

item.name: Queries which were dropped
item.description: Recursive queries for which the server discovered an excessive number of existing recursive queries for the same name, type and class and were subsequently dropped. This is the number of dropped queries due to the reason explained with the clients-per-query and max-clients-per-query options (see the description about clients-per-query.) This corresponds to the dropped counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item.name: Queries which were duplicates
item.description: Queries which the server attempted to recurse but discovered an existing query with the same IP address, port, query ID, name, type and class already being processed. This corresponds to the duplicate counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item.name: Other query failures
item.description: Other query failures. This corresponds to the failure counter of previous versions of BIND 9. Note: this counter is provided mainly for backward compatibility with the previous versions. Normally a more fine-grained counters such as AuthQryRej and RecQryRej that would also fall into this counter are provided, and so this counter would not be of much interest in practice.

item.name: Queries resulted in non authoritative answer
Queries resulted in NXDOMAIN
item.description: Queries resulted in NXDOMAIN. This corresponds to the nxdomain counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item.name: Queries resulted in NOERROR responses with no data
item.description: Queries resulted in NOERROR responses with no data. This corresponds to the nxrrset counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item.name: Queries which caused recursion
item.description: Queries which caused the server to perform recursion in order to find the final answer. This corresponds to the recursion counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item.name: Queries resulted in referral answer
item.description: Queries resulted in referral answer. This corresponds to the referral counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item.name: Queries resulted in a successful answer
item.description: Queries resulted in a successful answer. This means the query which returns a NOERROR response with at least one answer RR. This corresponds to the success counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item.name: Requests with unsupported EDNS version received
Requests with invalid (TSIG or SIG(0)) signature
IPv4 requests received
item.description: IPv4 requests received. Note: this also counts non query requests.

item.name: IPv6 requests received
item.description: IPv6 requests received. Note: this also counts non query requests.

item.name: Dynamic updates rejected due to prerequisite failure
Memory - Block Size
item.description: Memory block size

item.name: Memory - Context Size
item.description: Memory context size

item.name: Memory - In Use
item.description: Memory in use

item.name: Memory - Lost
item.description: Memory Lost

item.name: Memory - Total Usage
item.description: Total memory usage

item.name: Resolver - IPv4 NS address fetch failed
Resolver - IPv4 NS address fetches invoked
Resolver - IPv6 NS address fetch failed
Resolver - IPv6 NS address fetches invoked
Resolver - Mismatch responses received
item.description: Mismatch responses received. The DNS ID, response's source address, and/or the response's source port does not match what was expected. (The port must be 53 or as defined by the port option.) This may be an indication of a cache poisoning attempt.

item.name: Resolver - Failures in opening query sockets
item.description: Failures in opening query sockets. One common reason for such failures is a failure of opening a new socket due to a limitation on file descriptors.

trigger.name: Muitas falhas de abertura de conexão

item_prototype.name: Bind Queries resulted in authoritative answer - {#ZONE}
Bind Queries which were dropped - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Recursive queries for which the server discovered an excessive number of existing recursive queries for the same name, type and class and were subsequently dropped. This is the number of dropped queries due to the reason explained with the clients-per-query and max-clients-per-query options (see the description about clients-per-query.) This corresponds to the dropped counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item_prototype.name: Bind Queries which were duplicates - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Queries which the server attempted to recurse but discovered an existing query with the same IP address, port, query ID, name, type and class already being processed. This corresponds to the duplicate counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item_prototype.name: Bind Other query failures - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Other query failures. This corresponds to the failure counter of previous versions of BIND 9. Note: this counter is provided mainly for backward compatibility with the previous versions. Normally a more fine-grained counters such as AuthQryRej and RecQryRej that would also fall into this counter are provided, and so this counter would not be of much interest in practice.

item_prototype.name: Bind Queries resulted in non authoritative answer - {#ZONE}
Bind Queries resulted in NXDOMAIN - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Queries resulted in NXDOMAIN. This corresponds to the nxdomain counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item_prototype.name: Bind Queries resulted in NOERROR responses with no data - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Queries resulted in NOERROR responses with no data. This corresponds to the nxrrset counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item_prototype.name: Bind Queries which caused recursion - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Queries which caused the server to perform recursion in order to find the final answer. This corresponds to the recursion counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item_prototype.name: Bind Queries resulted in referral answer - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Queries resulted in referral answer. This corresponds to the referral counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item_prototype.name: Bind Queries resulted in a successful answer - {#ZONE}
item_prototype.description: Queries resulted in a successful answer. This means the query which returns a NOERROR response with at least one answer RR. This corresponds to the success counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

item_prototype.name: Bind Requests with unsupported EDNS version received - {#ZONE}
Bind Requests with invalid (TSIG or SIG(0)) signature - {#ZONE}
